intro: Racosperma validinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined acacia, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in dense spikes, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are often used in traditional Indigenous practices, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Racosperma validinervium plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
